Title: Data Scientist - ML
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.

Key Responsibilities:

Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.
Work across the latest data science platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn).
Support with building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) including Cloud provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform).
Advising to the business stakeholders on data driven marketing - working closely with third parties and, internally, with digital teams, IT, and others.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French/Dutch with good senior-level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.
Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Must have technical knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) or GenAI.
Industry skills: Manufacturing or Life sciences would be a plus.
Strong analytical skills and appreciation of coding languages, data sources, data matching and data acquisition.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
B.E.S. (Business and Engineering Solutions) is looking for a Data Scientist to coordinate, define and execute the data activities in the automotive sector.







Your responsabilities :

You implement feature engineering techniques to extract main features from events, manoeuvres, and trips,
You support study of driver behaviour based on time series big data and aggregated demographics,
You support Link Driver Behaviour comprehensive groups with market and persona data,
You provide support in the application of data science methods in study cases,
You analyse customer survey data and market data,




Your profile :

You have a Master degree,
You are fluent in English (written and spoken), French is a real asset,
You have a first experience (internship, apprenticeship) in data,
You are interested in working in a sector at the heart of innovation,
You have knowldege in Python,
You have experience with big data,
You can work autonomously.




What can you except as a B.E.S. consultant?




Great projects in Engineering and High Technologies through major players to develop your technical skills and hard skills
Knowledge sharing processes though our competences centers and experts' communities to grow your multi-sectorial knowledge
A strong development plan to improve your soft skills such as Leadership, Communication skills, Change & People management capabilities…
A full package made of gross salary on 13.92 months, lunch allowance, entertainment expenses, company car & fuel card, group insurances OR a VIE!
A friendly, lively working environment within a dynamic and motivated team !!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description



About the Role:
We are seeking a Data Analyst with a strong business mindset to join our team, focusing on providing analytical insights for our client's Claims department in the insurance industry. The successful candidate will leverage their expertise in data analysis to solve complex business problems, drive decision-making, and support process improvement initiatives within the Claims function.


Key Responsibilities:


Claims Payout Analysis: Analyze claims data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that impact business operations, enabling data-driven decisions and process improvements.
AI & Advanced Data Analytics: Contribute to cutting-edge AI and data analytics projects, applying innovative techniques to enhance claims management.
Ad-hoc Analysis: Conduct targeted analysis on claims-related topics, such as claims disputes, fraud detection, and the impact of new regulations or industry trends.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with Claims department stakeholders to understand their needs, translate them into analytical requirements, and deliver actionable insights.
Data Quality Monitoring: Continuously monitor and ensure the accuracy and integrity of data, proactively addressing any discrepancies.


Qualifications



Education: Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business) with a strong focus on data analysis.Experience:


2-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a business setting.
Proficiency in statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization.
Strong experience with data analysis techniques and tools, including SQL, Power BI, R, and Python.
Familiarity with SAS is a plus.
Experience in Non-Life insurance or working with Claims data is preferred.

Technical Skills:


Proficient in data analysis tools and techniques.
Expertise in SQL, Power BI, R, and Python.

Business Acumen:


Ability to understand and communicate business needs and translate them into analytical solutions.

Soft Skills:


Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner.
Strong ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Capable of managing multiple priorities and meeting tight deadlines.

Language Skills:


Fluent in English.
Good to fluent proficiency in Dutch and/or French.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About FURTHER

FURTHER is the leading AI-powered customer acquisition platform for senior care and healthcare organizations. Our digital experience platform and sales automation solutions make it easier for consumers to buy and easier for sales teams to sell, increasing conversion rates and driving incremental revenue for our clients. FURTHER is the only data platform in the industry that connects first-party marketing and sales data, making it easier for client marketing teams to be data-driven. FURTHER works with over 4,500 care communities and delivered $1.5B of revenue to our customers in 2023.

The Role

At Further, we transform data into actionable insights to drive our systems and solutions. We seek a creative and curious LLM engineer to join our team. If you have a Natural Language Processing and Software Engineering background, you’ll thrive in this role by developing and improving robust conversational agents that take their users to the next level. You'll collaborate with specialists to "slice and dice" data, develop conversational agents, identify enhancements, and deliver innovative solutions.


Collaborate with product design and engineering teams to understand business and data needs.
Develop, test, and deploy robust conversational agents that meet user needs and project requirements.
Continuously improve the natural language understanding (NLU) and overall performance of conversational agents through customization and optimization techniques.
Implement context-aware conversations and design conversation flows that handle complex user queries effectively.
Develop and execute test plans to assess agent performance, identifying areas for improvement and iterating on data, prompts, and workflows.
Communicate findings to stakeholders effectively.
Stay current with industry developments and technical advancements.


What You’ll Own


Collect, clean, and preprocess data to ensure quality and reliability.
Explore and visualize data to identify patterns, trends, and relationships
Train, evaluate, and deploy customized LLMs.
Test and refine models to ensure their effectiveness.
Monitor model performance and make necessary adjustments.
Present results and suggestions through clear visuals and concise reports.


What You’ll Bring


At least 5 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist or Engineer
Business level English verbal and writing.
A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
A minimum of two years experience as an ML engineer.
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools like SQL and Pandas.
Familiarity with Data Warehousing.
Experience in developing, evaluating, deploying, running, and maintaining ML models.
A strong understanding of AI agents, natural language processing, and machine learning concepts.
At least 5 years of experience using LLMs and LLM-enabled programs in a professional, academic, or personal context, including exploring how they work and how to use them effectively.
Experience with LangChain or other AI agent frameworks.
Experience with LLM observability.
Familiarity with the optimal use of LLMs, the tradeoff between fine-tuning and RAG, etc.
Familiarity with prompt engineering best practices.
Familiarity with data structures for ML and AI programs, including RAG and vector databases.
Experience with building systems and infrastructure is preferred.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.


Equal Opportunity Employer

We hire talented and passionate people from a variety of backgrounds because we want our global employee base to represent the wide diversity of our customers. If you’re excited about a role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every bullet point listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. If you’re a builder at heart, share our company values, and enthusiastic about making software toolmaking ubiquitous, we want to hear from you.

FURTHER is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. FURTHER considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. FURTHER is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Description

We currently have a vacancy for a Data Scientist fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company’s premises or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client’s IT team on site.


Your tasks

  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions;
  • Identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution;
  • Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience;
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL);
  • Produce data models according to specific problems statements;
  • Scripting and programming;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc…);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.

Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Experience in Azure;
  • Experience in using the suite of PowerApps;
  • Experience with languages like R, Python, PERL;
  • Experience in data visualization using power BI;
  • Excellent knowledge of Power app developer, low code and no code development;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;
  • Excellent knowledge of continuous code delivery and unit testing;
  • Excellent knowledge of SharePoint Online;
  • Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData…);
  • Good knowledge of ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio…);
  • Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Certifications in Microsoft Azure would be considered an asset;
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
As an Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).


Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment


Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...);
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a big plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.
  • Containerized deployment of ML products – e.g. docker, podman, Kubernetes


Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.


Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
OfferFit was founded by ex-McKinsey and BCG math PhDs, and we’re funded by leading Silicon Valley VCs. OfferFit replaces A/B testing with AI testing, powered by reinforcement learning AI. This allows lifecycle marketers to test & improve the performance of their campaigns much faster than before. Customers include leading brands like Brinks Home, Yelp, Engie, and MetLife, among many others.




Note for Applicants:




Data shows that men on average apply for a role if they meet 6/10 requirements while women often only do so if it’s 10/10. We work hard to be clear and specific about what our roles require, and we encourage you to apply even if you don’t check all the boxes! Applying gives you the opportunity to be considered and we look forward to reviewing your application!




Position Overview:




Do you enjoy working on data-intensive products and being involved in projects from an early stage? Come join our quickly growing Engineering team to help design, improve and scale OfferFit's self-learning (reinforcement learning) AI platform.




In particular, you will:




Use robust software engineering best practices to design, implement, and improve modular components in a cutting-edge ML product.
Work closely with customer-facing teams to understand, translate, and generalize particular use cases to generic platform components.
Apply your extensive knowledge of Python and its ecosystem to produce clean, readable, and extendible code, and coach others on the team in doing the same.
Collaborate with teams responsible for OfferFit’s product strategy and roadmap.
Support teams implementing OfferFit for customers to ensure their success.
Work closely with our Applied Science team (data scientists) to help productize and deploy attribution and reinforcement learning algorithm improvements
Improve our core data pipelines and reporting architecture.




Tech stack:




Data Science/Back End: Python (Pandas, Polars, Ibis, Spark), SQL, BigQuery, FastAPI
Web [Not required for this role]: JavaScript (Vue, Node.js), HTML, CSS
Architecture/DevOps: Kubernetes, Airflow, Terraform, GCP
We write well-tested, type-hinted, documented, modular code and use pre-commit hooks, CI/CD, and issue tracking for development.




Why is it great:




No toy datasets in notebooks — we’re implementing AI pipelines in production at scale!

Learn tons about data architecture, data science, and self-learning AI.
Work in a team that not only talks the talk of development best practices, but walks the walk — unit & integration tests, modular design, CI/CD, pair programming, code reviews — the works.
Join OfferFit’s fast-paced, supportive, and professional team. We make sure all of our team members are empowered and receive great mentorship and coaching.




Who’s a Fit:




Exceptional coder: you write clean, object-oriented code; you care about good design and terse, testable APIs.
Tinkerer: you regularly explore and learn new technologies and methods, especially in the data architecture and data science domains.
Entrepreneurial: you proactively identify opportunities and risks, work around obstacles, and always seek creative ways to improve processes and outcomes.
Structured and organized: you can structure a plan, align stakeholders, and see it through to execution.
Clear communicator: you are able to express yourself clearly and persuasively, both in writing and speech.
Background in Machine Learning Engineering and/or Data Engineering is preferred. Some Data Science experience is nice-to-have but is not required.




Ideal Skills and Experience:




2+ years of experience working with Python in a production setting, including 1+ years in the data / machine learning ecosystem
Experience working with at least one major cloud platform (GCP, AWS, Azure, etc.)
Experience putting ML models into production
General understanding of supervised learning principles is a plus but not required




OfferFit Benefits and Perks:




Generous PTO (starting at 25 days PTO per year) and Parental leave policy (12 weeks paid)
100% remote work environment with flexible hours
Quarterly gatherings where we meet in person in a different city to work together, bond as a team and celebrate our progress
Weekly team events (lunch and learns, trivia, virtual escape rooms, town hall and team health “barometer” meetings)
Ability to learn and develop from an experienced leadership team (ex-Amazon, McKinsey, BCG, and IBM, among others) who are focused on building a talented, diverse, and inclusive team
Dedication to building a strong culture (e.g., team resource groups, weekly recognitions, major life event celebrations, mental health/sustainability days off, etc.)




Additional Requirements:




Fluency in English is required for this position
Ability to partially overlap with US time zones required




OfferFit Benefits and Perks:




Generous PTO (starting at 25 days PTO per year) and Parental Leave policy (12 weeks paid)
100% remote work environment with flexible hours
Quarterly gatherings where we meet in person in a different city to work together, bond as a team and celebrate our progress
Weekly team events (lunch and learns, trivia, virtual escape rooms, town hall and team health “barometer” meetings)
Ability to learn and develop from an experienced leadership team (ex-Amazon, McKinsey, BCG, and IBM, among others) who are focused on building a talented, diverse, and inclusive team
Dedication to building a strong culture (e.g., team resource groups, weekly recognitions, major life event celebrations, mental health/sustainability days off, etc.)




Please note that we adjust compensation for non–US countries using a relative cost of labor adjustment between the US and your country of residence. Applicants should apply via OfferFit’s internal or external careers site.




OfferFit is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. OfferFit is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Applying gives you the opportunity to be considered and we look forward to reviewing your application!


Position Overview:


Do you enjoy working on data-intensive products and being involved in projects from an early stage? Come join our quickly growing Engineering team to help design, improve and scale OfferFit's self-learning (reinforcement learning) AI platform.


In particular, you will:


  • Use robust software engineering best practices to design, implement, and improve modular components in a cutting-edge ML product.
  • Work closely with customer-facing teams to understand, translate, and generalize particular use cases to generic platform components.
  • Apply your extensive knowledge of Python and its ecosystem to produce clean, readable, and extendible code, and coach others on the team in doing the same.
  • Collaborate with teams responsible for OfferFit’s product strategy and roadmap.
  • Support teams implementing OfferFit for customers to ensure their success.
  • Work closely with our Applied Science team (data scientists) to help productize and deploy attribution and reinforcement learning algorithm improvements
  • Improve our core data pipelines and reporting architecture.


Tech stack:


  • Data Science/Back End: Python (Pandas, Polars, Ibis, Spark), SQL, BigQuery, FastAPI
  • Web [Not required for this role]: JavaScript (Vue, Node.js), HTML, CSS
  • Architecture/DevOps: Kubernetes, Airflow, Terraform, GCP
  • We write well-tested, type-hinted, documented, modular code and use pre-commit hooks, CI/CD, and issue tracking for development.


Why is it great:


No toy datasets in notebooks — we’re implementing AI pipelines in production at scale!

  1. Learn tons about data architecture, data science, and self-learning AI.
  2. Work in a team that not only talks the talk of development best practices, but walks the walk — unit & integration tests, modular design, CI/CD, pair programming, code reviews — the works.
  3. Join OfferFit’s fast-paced, supportive, and professional team. We make sure all of our team members are empowered and receive great mentorship and coaching.


Who’s a Fit:


  • Exceptional coder: you write clean, object-oriented code; you care about good design and terse, testable APIs.
  • Tinkerer: you regularly explore and learn new technologies and methods, especially in the data architecture and data science domains.
  • Entrepreneurial: you proactively identify opportunities and risks, work around obstacles, and always seek creative ways to improve processes and outcomes.
  • Structured and organized: you can structure a plan, align stakeholders, and see it through to execution.
  • Clear communicator: you are able to express yourself clearly and persuasively, both in writing and speech.
  • Background in Machine Learning Engineering and/or Data Engineering is preferred. Some Data Science experience is nice-to-have but is not required.


Ideal Skills and Experience:


  • 2+ years of experience working with Python in a production setting, including 1+ years in the data / machine learning ecosystem
  • Experience working with at least one major cloud platform (GCP, AWS, Azure, etc.)
  • Experience putting ML models into production
  • General understanding of supervised learning principles is a plus but not required


OfferFit Benefits and Perks:


  • Generous PTO (starting at 25 days PTO per year) and Parental leave policy (12 weeks paid)
  • 100% remote work environment with flexible hours
  • Quarterly gatherings where we meet in person in a different city to work together, bond as a team and celebrate our progress
  • Weekly team events (lunch and learns, trivia, virtual escape rooms, town hall and team health “barometer” meetings)
  • Ability to learn and develop from an experienced leadership team (ex-Amazon, McKinsey, BCG, and IBM, among others) who are focused on building a talented, diverse, and inclusive team
  • Dedication to building a strong culture (e.g., team resource groups, weekly recognitions, major life event celebrations, mental health/sustainability days off, etc.)


Additional Requirements:


  • Fluency in English is required for this position
  • Ability to partially overlap with US time zones required


OfferFit Benefits and Perks:


  • Generous PTO (starting at 25 days PTO per year) and Parental Leave policy (12 weeks paid)
  • 100% remote work environment with flexible hours
  • Quarterly gatherings where we meet in person in a different city to work together, bond as a team and celebrate our progress
  • Weekly team events (lunch and learns, trivia, virtual escape rooms, town hall and team health “barometer” meetings)
  • Ability to learn and develop from an experienced leadership team (ex-Amazon, McKinsey, BCG, and IBM, among others) who are focused on building a talented, diverse, and inclusive team
  • Dedication to building a strong culture (e.g., team resource groups, weekly recognitions, major life event celebrations, mental health/sustainability days off, etc.)


Please note that we adjust compensation for non–US countries using a relative cost of labor adjustment between the US and your country of residence. Applicants should apply via OfferFit’s internal or external careers site.


OfferFit is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. OfferFit is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Title: Data Scientist - GenAI
Description:
Data Scientist - GenAI

Fully Remote in Europe (Need to be +2/-2 hours of the UK)

Are you problem-solver and passionate about designing new AI infrastructure features?

We are partnered with a leading Kubernetes automation platform company disrupting the combination of Cloud technology and AI. We are searching a Data Scientist to design and be a decision-maker on a greenfield project within an impressive AI scale-up. Your responsibilities would include evaluating and analyzing LLM performance, optimizing state-of-the-art AI models, and developing and implementing complex data science solutions.

We would love to speak to you if you:

Have worked hands-on with NLP and/or LLMs
Have worked on Software Engineering, in industry and in Python or Golang programming
Have hands-on experience in Data Science and Machine Learning,
Are able to communicate in English

Ready for the next step in your career? Apply now!

Please note, we cannot accept applications from the UK and Germany.

Title: Data Scientist - Global Payments & Fraud Management
Description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

Role overview:

Interested in working on strategic initiatives that allow for creativity and room for growth? Do you have strong passion for using data and cutting-edge technologies to drive the best business decisions? If so, read on…

Sony Interactive Entertainment’s (SIE) Global Fraud Management and Global Payment (GPFM) Teams are the guardians of both customer trust and purchase success for PlayStation and the PlayStation® Network (PSN). We provide innovative solutions to support every element of the network, various platform services, customer service teams, a diverse developer community, and more.

We recently launched a next generation risk platform and machine learning framework that support the global, fast-growing PlayStation® Network customer base, world class PlayStation® consoles, hand-held devices, PlayStation® TV, and many more! In doing so, the ability to extract information from data and drive action that help achieve business goals is essential. GPFM’s Data Science team is responsible for evaluating online user activity data for potential fraud across this new platform. Our job is to provide quantitative assessments of all customers and identify those individuals who pose the most risk to our businesses.

What you'll be doing:


Utilise various approaches to maximise value from predictive analytics solutions.
Optimise use of developed Machine-Learning algorithms in conjunction with other aspects of decision logic (rules, other models, etc.)
Demonstrate understanding of predictive modelling methodology that detect fraud and other ecommerce risks.
Provide feedback to modellers on new features, algos, strategy, and modelling ideas.
Conduct robust statistical analysis to big data using hypothesis testing, design of experiment, inferential statistics, and more.
Improve decision performance by analysing misclassification cases, hit rates, and customer feedback.
Coordinate, document and simplify rule assessment.
Develop deep understanding of business challenges and recommend data features and functionality that can contribute to identifying risk and possible fraud.
Assist the Software Development and Peer team members in testing and deploying decision changes (rules, models, etc.) on the newly created platform.


What we're looking for:


Master’s degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Machine Learning, Computer Science or other related fields
2+ years working with statistical modelling techniques (Classification, Regression, CHAID, Neural Networks, Cluster Analysis, RFs, XGBs, etc.).
Hands-on statistical analysis experience with some understanding of a statistical programming package such as R/Python/Java/other is required, and some visualization applications using Tableau/R Shiny/Python Dash.
Experience performing large scale data manipulation to assess, clean, merge, and analyses large data sets from different data warehouse sources (Hive, Hadoop, MySQL, SQL, Snowflake, etc.).
A passion for analysing highly complex data sets, an entrepreneurial spirit, a relentless customer-focus, a practical understanding of quantitative methods, and superb attention to detail.


Desirable skills:


Demonstrable experience working with Optimisation, statistical analysis, machine learning or text classification algorithms.
Solid understanding of predictive modelling, data manipulation, unstructured data processing, and data value assessment.
Creation and understanding of macros for automating above mentioned processes is strongly preferred!


Please refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (base in Vienna)
Description:
Our client is an Austrian Fintech company specialised in Big Data, Low Latency and Trend Forecasting for the FX and crypto market.




Looking to fill the role of a data scientists with a focus on developing statistical and machine learning models in FX applications.




Main responsibilities :

Support the data science team: Data aggregation, generation of insights, modelling.

Development of statistics models / ML models for a range of FX use cases.

Willingness to learn new languages and frameworks to identify the tools best suited for the objective.




Required experience :

Actual experience in statistics (beyond simple models)

Development of machine learning models

SQL, Python




Desired experience :

Background in natural sciences, math, information science or other statistics-adjacent fields

Kafka; stream processing

Collaboration in development teams: Git, CI/CD,

Timeseries databases / OLTP / OLAP

Spark/Scala

Experience in high frequency finance / FX




Job base in Vienna or Bratislava (according to your preference).

Salary range : 50,000€ - 55,000€ gross per year

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
We're looking for a consultant for a long term mission or freelancer is also possible.

To start ASAP




We are seeking a talented LLM engineer to join our data science and software development team. The primary responsibility of this role to fine tune and implement pretrained Large Langue Models (LLMs). You further collaborate with various stakeholders to identify

other potential use cases. Once you've build a successful prototype, you work closely together with our software engineers to translate your Proof Of Concept (POC) into a mature software product. When more traditional natural language processing (NLP) algorithms suffice, you train, test and implement the appropriate models (e.g. named entity recognition, text classification or categorization, ...).







Key Responsibilities

brainstorm with stakeholders, identify potential use cases, document user and functional requirements
translate requirements into data pipeline, model and software architecture (you will be assisted by a data engineer and software architect)
fine tune and implement LLM models, test and optimize model performance
develop scalable, performant and reliable NLP algorithms
define, conduct and evaluate POCs
collaborate with cross-functional teams to embed LLM models and NLP algorithms in mature software applications




Skills & Qualifications

Master degree in computer science or related filed
7 years of work experience
proven experience developing NLP algorithms and implementing LLM technology
proficiency in programming languages such as Python and C++
experience with NLP frameworks and libraries (spaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, Tensorflow, Scikit-learn, Hugging Face)
strong understanding of machine learning and deep learning techniques
strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
fluent in English and Dutch
analytical mindset, pragmatic problem solver
ability to collaborate in cross functional teams




Interested?

Please me your cv to anne@bimona.be

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.




For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.




You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Science solutions
Going into production with Data Engineers
Creation of POC, model development
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?

You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Als ervaren data scientist puur je relevante inzichten uit de grote hoeveelheid data waarover Colruyt Group beschikt. Je maakt statistische modellen en geeft strategisch advies aan onze verschillende retailmerken. Het resultaat van jouw werk: een nog betere dienstverlening op maat van onze klanten.




Wat doe je concreet?




In de divisie Data & Analytics werk je in multidisciplinair team bestaand uit data science engineers, bi engineers, business analysts, … Samen bieden jullie analytische oplossingen aan voor de verschillende Colruyt Group merken, zoals Colruyt, Okay, Bike-Republic of Jims. In het data science kennisgroep worden ervaringen en kennis uitgewisseld. Op deze manier blijf je bijleren.
Als data scientist werk je samen met complementaire collega’s aan een brede waaier van projecten waarbij je in aanraking komt met nieuwe technieken en technologieën. We moedigen je ook aan om zelf, in overleg met het team, op zoek te gaan naar nieuwe methoden en technieken en zo de kennis en skills van de groep te vergroten. Naast een heel ruim aanbod aan interne opleidingen krijg je ook de kans om aanvullende opleidingstrajecten te volgen. Op die manier bouw je continu aan je business-kennis, je technische skills en je sociale vaardigheden.
Met het team focussen we enerzijds op onze interne klanten, de business-partners. We vertalen hun vragen in analytische projecten die we aanpakken in multidisciplinaire teams. Dat resulteert in een directe en nauwe samenwerking met ETL, software development en de businesspartner.
Anderzijds zijn we ook verantwoordelijk voor de identificatie van nieuwe analytics-opportuniteiten. We gaan proactief op zoek naar nieuwe inzichten die een toegevoegde waarde creëren voor onze partners. Daarbij kijken we uiteraard niet alleen naar Colruyt Group, maar volgen we ook de externe trends op het vlak van use cases rond analytics en technologische innovatie.
Colruyt Group bestaat uit veel verschillende entiteiten. Dat zorgt voor een enorme variatie en hoeveelheid aan data én use cases. De projecten waar je aan meewerkt gaan dan ook van klantensegmentatie over verkoopsprognose en analyse van winkeltesten tot operationele efficiëntie van machines, predictive maintenance en optimaal gebruik van grondstoffen.




Je werkt in Halle en kan tot drie dagen per week thuiswerken.




Profiel




Opleiding en ervaring – Je hebt een solide basis in handels- en of computerwetenschappen, statistiek, wiskunde of ingenieursstudies. Je hebt minstens 3 tot 5 jaar relevante ervaring.
ennis statistische modellering – Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van statistische modellering en kan deze implementeren in Python. Je hebt kennis van SQL en datavisualisatie-technieken.
Analytisch vermogen – Je slaagt erin om data te vertalen naar inzichten en je kan die ook helder en duidelijk communiceren.
Talenkennis – Kennis van het Nederlands is een must. Je praat zeer vlot Engels. Kennis van het Frans is een plus.




Wij bieden




Stimulerende werkomgeving – Je belandt in een ongelooflijk boeiende en rijke data-omgeving, krijgt ruimte voor initiatief en krijgt een brede kijk op het bedrijf.
Permanente leermogelijkheden – Je leert dagelijks bij en krijgt ook de kans om jouw talenten te ontwikkelen via interne en externe opleidingen. Op termijn zijn er ook reële doorgroeikansen.
Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je krijgt een competitief loon met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, winstdeelname en maaltijdcheques.

Show more

Je werkt in Halle en kan tot drie dagen per week thuiswerken.


Profiel


  • Opleiding en ervaring – Je hebt een solide basis in handels- en of computerwetenschappen, statistiek, wiskunde of ingenieursstudies. Je hebt minstens 3 tot 5 jaar relevante ervaring.
  • ennis statistische modellering – Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van statistische modellering en kan deze implementeren in Python. Je hebt kennis van SQL en datavisualisatie-technieken.
  • Analytisch vermogen – Je slaagt erin om data te vertalen naar inzichten en je kan die ook helder en duidelijk communiceren.
  • Talenkennis – Kennis van het Nederlands is een must. Je praat zeer vlot Engels. Kennis van het Frans is een plus.


Wij bieden


  • Stimulerende werkomgeving – Je belandt in een ongelooflijk boeiende en rijke data-omgeving, krijgt ruimte voor initiatief en krijgt een brede kijk op het bedrijf.
  • Permanente leermogelijkheden – Je leert dagelijks bij en krijgt ook de kans om jouw talenten te ontwikkelen via interne en externe opleidingen. Op termijn zijn er ook reële doorgroeikansen.
  • Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je krijgt een competitief loon met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, winstdeelname en maaltijdcheques.

Title: Data Scientist Banking
Description:
About the job

If you're a data scientist with 3-5 years of experience and a desire to propel businesses forward, then Sailpeak wants to hear from you! We're seeking a talented individual to join our team and play a crucial role in helping our clients unlock the power of their data.




***DISCLAIMER: Candidates must have the legal right to work in the EU without requiring visa sponsorship****




About Sailpeak




Sailpeak is a leading management consulting firm based in the heart of Europe (Brussels), dedicated to guiding businesses through transformative moments of both challenge and opportunity. Our team collaborates with a diverse range of organizations, from startups to multinational giants, primarily focusing on Financial Services. Together, we design and implement cutting-edge solutions that foster growth, sustainability, and success.




Role and Responsibilities




In this role, you'll be a key member of our team, partnering with consultants and founders to leverage data for strategic decision-making. Your responsibilities will include:




Drive data-driven insights: Analyze complex data sets to uncover actionable insights that inform strategic decision-making.
Develop cutting-edge solutions: Lead ambitious projects by developing innovative applications based on LLMs and other advanced technologies.
Mentor and grow talent: Guide and mentor a team of junior data scientists to foster their professional development.
Collaborate with clients: Partner with consultants and executives to understand business objectives and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Stay ahead of the curve: Continuously learn and apply new data science techniques to remain at the forefront of the field.




Requirements




Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field
3-5 years of experience working as a Data Scientist or similar role.
Strong experience in programming languages like Python (including libraries like pandas, scikit-learn, etc.), SQL and/or Matlab
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
Proven ability to design, build, and deploy machine learning models.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex data insights to a non-technical audience.
Collaborative mindset with a passion for teamwork.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Fluency in English and in French or Dutch.




Benefits




Joining Sailpeak as a Data Scientist in Banking offers:

The opportunity to collaborate with top-tier banking clients, gaining exposure to diverse financial industries.
Mentorship and guidance from experienced Directors and Partners with backgrounds from renowned companies like Google, PayPal, Semetis, and Sia Partners.
Continuous opportunities for learning and professional development.
A vibrant and inclusive workplace culture that values individual contributions and teamwork.
Competitive compensation package.




How to Apply




If you're ready to take the next step in your career with Sailpeak, apply for the position of Data Scientist Banking by sending the following to careers@sailpeak.com:

Your up-to-date CV/resume.
A cover letter outlining your interest in the role and your relevant qualifications.
Details of any academic or professional achievements or projects.




Chart a course toward a transformative career at Sailpeak today!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Python Engineer – UK / Remote In Europe – AI Content Generation Platform - £65,000




I am excited to be partnered with an extremely exciting AI start up who are building an innovative AI content generation platform.




Being supported by some of the best contributors to LLMs & Opensource AI they have already secured multiple $M of funding and are on track to scale significantly in the next year.




They currently have 13 members within the team and are currently looking to add another Python engineer into the team.




Company




The company are developing a AI platform utalising the most up to date LLM & AI technologies for content generation, which can take almost any form!




You will be tasked with assisting the companies ML/ LLM engineers on the wider platform development / engineering tasks and improving inefficiencies within the current design whilst working on improving the overall efficiency of the platform in the long-term.




Requirements

Very experienced with the latest Python versions and packages
Experience working closely with ML teams
Experience with unit testing and TDD
Experience with open source projects




Benefits

Salary up to £65,000 (plus generous equity)
Fully remote working with CET/CEST time zones
Working under a world-class team that are leading in this industry

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a data analyst with a business mindset. The successful candidate will work in an environment that presents opportunities to apply analytical skills to solve business problems for mainly our Claims department.

The candidate will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects, including:


AI & Advanced Data Analytics projects in the domain of Claims.
Claims payout analysis: The data analyst will be responsible for analyzing claims data to identify trends and patterns that may impact business operations. This analysis will help the Claims department to make data-driven decisions related to claims management and identify opportunities for process improvement.
Other ad-hoc analysis: The data analyst may be asked to conduct ad-hoc analysis on a range of topics related to claims management. This may include investigating the root causes of claims disputes, identifying patterns in claims fraud, and analyzing the impact of new regulations or industry trends on claims management.


Objective of the job


Work with stakeholders in the Claims department to understand their needs and translate them into specific analytical requirements.
Design, develop, and implement solutions for data analysis, modeling, and reporting, using both internal and external data sources.
Identify and communicate insights from data analysis to support decision-making and problem-solving activities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data-related issues.
Continuously monitor data quality and accuracy, and proactively identify and resolve data discrepancies.


Expected Start date: 01/10/2024

Duration: 24 months (Depending on project evolution, extension is possible)

Languages : Fluency in English, French and Dutch

Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business) or a related field with a strong focus on data analysis.

Skills

SKILLS mandatory - Mid-level (2 y - 5 y)


Data analysis, preferably in a business setting
Statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization
Data analysis techniques and tools
SQL
PBI
R
Pyhton
SAS (plus)
Strong business acumen and the ability to understand and communicate business needs and requirements
Experience with Non-Life insurance or Claims data is a plus.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer – AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ years’ experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Description

We currently have a vacancy for a Data Scientist fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert remotely. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client’s IT team.

Your Tasks

  • Coordination and review of policy units’ business needs;
  • Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks;
  • Creating, designing and developing data models;
  • Analyze large datasets and propose approaches for optimization of reporting;
  • Assessment and quality control of data;
  • Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders;
  • Management and processing of data;
  • Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available;
  • Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI;
  • Assistance with data management aspects of IT projects.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with 5 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;
  • Very good knowledge of reporting and statistics;
  • Good knowledge of Power BI;
  • Experience with one or more of the following: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, Languages like R, Python, PERL, Other business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData…), ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio…);
  • Knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);
  • Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems;
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
As an Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.


Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).


Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment


Technical skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...);
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:

-Translating business requests into data requirements.

- Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.

- Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).

- Deploying scalable AI applications to production.

  • Any experience with following elements is a big plus:

- MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

- Containerized deployment of ML products – e.g. docker, podman, Kubernetes


Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.


Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ITMAGINATION helps its Clients by becoming a true extension of their software and data development capabilities. Through the readily set up, comprehensive, and self-governing teams, we let our Clients focus on their business while we make sure that their software products and data tools scale up accordingly and with outstanding quality.

We are looking for experienced team players to fill the Data Scientist position and participate in our up-and-coming project for our client from the pharmaceutical industry.

You can expect:


Collaborating with a talented and motivated team professionals
Involvement in impactful projects that drive business success


Requirements


Min. 5 years of relevant experience as a Data Scientist
Strong programming skills in Python or R
Experience with data manipulation and processing
Proficiency in NLP and working with LLMs
Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and techniques
Strong English skills for effective team communication


Benefits


Fully remote work model
Possibility of 20 business days off each year
Professional training programs – including Udemy and other development plans
Benefits package offer - Health Insurance, Sports Package, and Life Insurance offerings
Work with a team that’s recognized for its excellence. We’ve been featured in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 & FT 1000 rankings. We’ve also received the Great Place To Work® certification for five years in a row

Title: (Gen) AI and Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As Stephen Few states: “We are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.” Capgemini Insights & Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.




We are looking for a (GEN) AI and Machine Learning Engineer to help our clients in their digital transformations.




Key tasks & activities

Use ML and Generative AI tools and other technologies to design, evangelize, and implement state-of-the-art solutions for never-before-solved problems.
Define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions, with a focus on generative models and LLM.
Drive successful business outcomes for educating, training, designing and building cloud hosted Generative AI solutions
Interact with customers directly to understand the business problem, help and aid them in implementation of their ML ecosystem
Educate customers on the value proposition of GenAI and showcase the art of possible.
Participate in deep architectural discussions and design exercises to create solutions while ensuring solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
Stay at the forefront of AI technological advancements, especially in Generative AI and LLM, and assess their applicability to our business needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, AI/ML & data engineers, and functional SMEs, to ensure seamless integration and alignment of AI solutions with business objectives. influence the technical viability of the architecture of AI projects, ensuring optimal performance, scalability, and integration.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies, advocating for the adoption of technologies that align with our strategic goals.




Knowledge & Experience

Experience in leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies to optimize and transform various aspects of our business operations.
Minimum of 4 years of experience in designing and building AI solutions, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Proven expertise in machine learning techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Experience with one of the cloud platforms, preferably Azure
Experience with Python or PySpark.
Experience in using Data Science Platforms
Experience using the latest Data Science platforms (e.g. Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker ) and frameworks (e.g. Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn )
Good understanding of software architecture patterns & application development.
Familiarity with DevOps,DataOps,MLOps, LLMOps principles including code repository, code management, CI/CD and AI-related automation.
Strong communication skills for both presenting work to clients, disseminating complex information in an easy-to-understand form on a day-to-day basis, and managing stakeholders.
Native speaker in Dutch or French with professional working proficiency in English.




#GetTheFutureYouWant




At Capgemini, we believe in diversity, equal opportunities, and a workplace where everyone feels valued. We take good care of people and help them make progress by assigning challenging projects and providing ample opportunities for personal growth and learning. We are looking for experienced professionals ready for their next career move.

You will join the I&D team, an ambitious, collaborative, supportive environment—problem-solvers with a strong focus on exchanging best practices to deliver exceptional results with Data science. Here, the knowledge of each team member and their own expertise is valuable to enable effective decision-making, proactive planning, and smooth project execution.




In return, we offer an attractive salary with fringe benefits:

A hybrid or electric company car (or mobility budget)
Meal & eco vouchers
Group & health insurance
Flexible work hours & the opportunity to work from home (70% of the time)
32 vacation days & 45 workcation days (to work abroad)
Intensive training and certification at all levels to keep you up to date with the latest trends & technologies




Apply now! We'd love to hear from you.




For more information: contact liz.nzimbula@capgemini.com or visit www.capgemini.com

Apply now! We'd love to hear from you.


For more information: contact liz.nzimbula@capgemini.com or visit www.capgemini.com

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to apply Data, ML & GenAI technology to create meaningful impact with digital products at scale, solve the needs of its users and tackle real-world problems in the world of digital & business? Are you up for the challenge to scale AI applications to hundred thousands of users, balancing best engineering practices and continuous user feedback? Then the role of a Senior Machine Learning Engineer will definitely trigger your interest!

In The Pocket's mission is to create digital products that make people happy and businesses grow. We believe both aspects are crucial for successful digital products, and they will often drive one another. Generative AI, Machine Learning & Data technologies allow us to improve both: by improving the experience of existing products, by enabling new business models based on newly uncovered insights and by enabling a whole range of new digital products with new value streams. Let's leverage ML & data to build even better digital products.







What you’ll do:

You'll closely collaborate with ML Engineers, Product Managers, Architects, and Software Engineers to define, implement and improve use cases that are enabled through machine learning. You are responsible for the life-cycle of the AI solution. This includes designing, developing testing, improving deploying and scaling the model that is used. There will be a focus on MLOps and the ability to scale modern NLP applications both in amount of users and data. But you don't do this in a vacuum. Rather, you're part of a multidisciplinary team where every member is equally responsible for the product's success
You keep up with the latest Data, Machine Learning & Generative AI advances, with a particular focus on what might be applicable in our context. In particular, your enthusiasm for "what is possible" motivates you and we expect you to transfer that enthusiasm to your team members and even our clients
You actively participate in knowledge sharing both towards peers (lessons learned, new advances, process improvements,..) as well as other people in our organisation (e.g. sales, marketing, product, strategy...). And it doesn't have to stop there: we happily support any initiatives to share our findings with the world, through blogs, talks, podcasts or guest lectures
You clearly communicate and set expectations. What realistic results can be expected? What are the greatest risks/unknowns? Always be open and honest, and don't be afraid to ask for help







Who you are:

You hold a bachelor/master/PhD degree in Computer Science (or related), and a master in Data Science / AI / Statistics or Machine Learning - or you have a proven track record in a similar role
You have a profound knowledge of Python and at least one of the most important machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch,...) and are able to work AI platforms like Huggingface, replicate and/or AI cloud services like Vertex AI Studio, AWS Sagemaker or Azure AI Studio
You have relevant experience in going beyond running local ML experiments, but bringing ML to production, including MLOps, Data versioning, & LLM Orchestration frameworks
You have a broad awareness of the possibilities and limitations of ML, and see how Data and ML can help us build even better products for our clients.
You have an affinity with product design and engineering top-notch digital products
You highly value the principles of clean code, continuous improvement and rapid prototyping. Experience with continuous delivery and/or devops practices is a plus
Any experience with the broader services from Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure is a plus
You excel in sharing your knowledge with others, you enjoy coaching team members and helping them to gain more insights in your field of expertise







Additional information:

Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. We rely on trust and openness, and sharing our learning curve. At In The Pocket, there’s time to experiment and budget to develop yourself.




On a personal level, we’re looking for someone who shares our values:




Ownership: Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. You take ownership and show the ability to decide and act for the good of the company
Integrity: Stick to your values, even when it doesn’t pay off in the short term. In The Pocket relies on trust and openness, which in turn relies on your integrity
Lead & Educate: Digital technologies are changing the world. We go all in, head-first. We take the lead in designing and building with emerging technologies. We share our passion and knowledge with as many people as possible.
Agility: In The Pocket is permanently under construction. We never settle, it’s never done. Observing, adapting and improving is in our nature. That resonates with the people who work here. We are always looking for a better solution, always ready for the next step, pragmatic and committed to moving forward
Team: As individuals, we are bright and talented, as a team we are unbeatable. We are open and positive, constructive and honest. We help and inspire our colleagues to do their best work.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Solutions / Customer Facing)
Description:
🌍 Machine Learning Engineer | Remote | Geospatial




Ready to shape the future of geospatial AI? Join a dynamic start-up that’s transforming how organizations tackle global challenges like climate change and economic development with real-time geospatial data. This is fully remote position with occasional meet-ups.




We are seeking a Geospatial Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you'll be integral in developing sophisticated ML solutions that leverage geospatial data. You'll take on the challenge of transforming data into actionable insights and building end-to-end solutions.




What We’re Looking For:

Geospatial experience
Experience as an Engineer with Python & PyTorch
Cloud experience (we use AWS)




Additional Details:

Competitive salary up to €80,000, based on experience, plus equity opportunities.
Fully remote position with occasional team meet-ups (USA and Europe once a year).
Must have EU work rights (EU passport or residency). Visa sponsorship is not available.




Interested? Apply now!

  • Geospatial experience
  • Experience as an Engineer with Python & PyTorch
  • Cloud experience (we use AWS)

Interested? Apply now!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for..

a data scientist with a strong knowledge in machine and deep learning to strengthen the activities of our innovation team and Earth Observation activities. GIM uses an open innovation approach to respond flexibly to our rapidly changing ecosystem and to continuously renew our products and services portfolio.







Below you will not find a standard vacancy, you will read a short story about where you will make the difference. Do you want work with us on a society in which geospatial data empower people to live better lives and make better decisions? Get in touch!







As experienced data science professional

I am the driving force behind our Earth Observation AI developments that are used for the further extension of our Belmap product and on customer projects. I actively follow-up new developments and technologies in the data science / machine learning / deep learning & computer vision domains. I provide technical input for research proposals centered around AI for GEO and Earth Observation, and implement the resulting innovation projects.




I contribute to our excellent customer experience by supporting my sales colleagues on their customer visits and contribute to the (pre)sales process by thinking along with the customer, delivering technical advice and giving demos. Together with the team, I translate the customer needs into a concrete project strategy and set up an action plan to ensure the successful delivery of the customer solution. My fluency in Dutch (mandatory!) as well as English, is a big asset in this context. I keep an eye on the project agreements that were made regarding budget, planning and deadlines, and contribute to great project results. My experience with working on complex projects and my excellent communication skills ensure that we create win-win situations with our customers.




I keep up-to-date on the newest technical and scientific developments within the machine learning, Earth Observation and geotechnology domains and share my knowledge with my GIM colleagues. By continuously renewing this technological knowledge and applying it to rapidly evolving customer demands, I also help to ensure that GIMs' products and services portfolio continues to meet the future needs of customers.







What do we offer you?

At GIM we are convinced that employees make the difference. This is why we give them every opportunity to shine in a self-organizing context where we distribute clear areas of responsibility with lots of decision power. We offer you a versatile function in a dynamic and highly innovative company, excellent working conditions and real possibilities for career development. Our salary packages are market conform with excellent fringe benefits, and we give you the choice to opt for a mobility budget, fitting to your personal needs.
